item.title: Nominations for EPA Region 4 Rain Catcher Award-Deadline is March 15, 2017
item.description: ATLANTA – For the fourth consecutive year, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is accepting nominations for the Rain Catcher Awards for excellence in implementation of stormwater green infrastructure projects during the past year.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Rebates Will Fund Cleaner School Bus Fleets in South Carolina Communities
item.description: ATLANTA - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today awarded more than $7.7 million to replace or retrofit 401 older diesel school buses.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Gives $3.8M to Help 19 Communities Plan New Uses for Former Brownfield Sites
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has selected 19 communities for approximately $3.8 million in funding to assist with planning for cleanup and reuse of Brownfield sites as part of the Brownfields Area-Wide Planning (AWP) program.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Helps Myrtle Beach Community Meet Environmental Goals, Foster Economic Development
item.description: ATLANTA – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) today announced that 25 communities will receive technical assistance to pursue development strategies that advance clean air, clean water, economic development and other local goals.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EXXONMOBIL TO RECEIVE EPA’s “EXCELLENCE IN SITE RE-USE” AWARD FOR VCC INITIATIVE
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Celebrates the Release of the EJ 2020 Action Agenda with Partners in North Charleston, S.C.
item.description: ATLANTA – Today, representatives from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) highlighted the release of the Environmental Justice 2020 Action Agenda (EJ 2020) at an event in North Charleston, S.C.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA Inducts Second Class of the Environmental Justice Academy
item.description: ATLANTA – Today, representatives from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) inducted 17 participants to the second class of the Environmental Justice (EJ) Academy.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA and Partners Join White House Officials to Convene First Clean Energy Savings for All Summit and Kick-off Redevelopment of Former Landfill into a Solar Farm in Spartanburg, S.C.
item.description: ATLANTA – Today, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and senior Obama Administration officials convened in Spartanburg, S.C., to host a Clean Energy Savings for All Summit – the first of a series planned across the country.
item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: EPA and DOT Finalize Greenhouse Gas and Fuel Efficiency Standards for Heavy-Duty Trucks

item.dc:creator: Region 04

item.title: Colletton County Museum and Farmers Market to host Local Foods, Local Places Workshop
item.description: ATLANTA – The Colletton County Museum and Farmers Market in Walterboro, SC has been selected as one of several rural community projects across the country to participate in Local Foods, Local Places (LFLP), a federal initiative that helps communities increase economic opportunities for local farm
item.dc:creator: Region 04
